01/27/11 05:03 PM ET Rep. Mike Pence ( R-Ind.) will not make a bid for the GOP presidential nomination in 2012, telling supporters in a letter that he would rather serve the state of Indiana. In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana, Mike Pence wrote, Still, Mike Pence is not officially jumping into the race for Indiana governor just yet. The congressman said he expects to make a decision "later this year" about his next step

whether to seek the governor's position or run for re-election to his congressional seat. Mike Pence can't raise funds for a gubernatorial race until April 30- giving him plenty of time to make a decision. In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana, Mike Pence said. "We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012." He's real. He's not a machine. It goes to show you this game is so competitive, even the guys on top can hit a wall somewhere.
